title: Brooklyn Beckham is named Tatler's most eligible bachelor of 2019
text:
It's usually young earls, dukes and princes who top Tatler's annual list of most eligible bachelors.

But it's aspiring photographer and celebrity offspring Brooklyn Beckham who has been named as the society bible's top pick for 2019.

According to the glossy magazine, the 20-year-old son of David and Victoria Beckham is the most sought after singleton of the year following his split from model Hana Cross this summer.

No. 1: Brooklyn Beckham, the 20-year-old son of David and Victoria Beckham is the most sought after singleton of the year following his split from model Hana Cross this summer

'Easily identifiable by his Victorian chimneysweep style, newly single Brooklyn, 20, has almost as many tattoos as his father and just as much charm,' writes Tatler.

'The up-and-coming photographer FaceTimes his family from photoshoots.'

Beckham, who deferred his four-year photography course at Parsons School of Design in New York last year due to homesickness, is currently interning with celebrated photographer, Rankin.

Tatler's top 10 most eligible bachelors Brooklyn Beckham, 20 James Chester Campbell, Viscount Emlyn, 21 Honorable Vere Harmsworth, 24 Harry Styles, 25 Maro Itoje, 24 Paul Henkel, 23 Jofra Archer, 24 Umar Kamani, 31 Mathew Healy, 30 Charles Robert George Innes-Ker, 38, who is the 11th Duke of Roxburghe

James Chester Campbell, Viscount Emlyn, 21, is the second most eligible bachelor on the list after modelling for Holland & Holland, designed by his mother Isabella Cawdor.

According to Tatler, when he 'splits his time between Scotland and Notting Hill - when he's not in Argentina playing polo, that is.'

Viscount Rothermere's son, the Honorable Vere Harmsworth, 24, who is 'obsessed with the family's Chihuahuas and loves polo', is third on the list, followed by former One Direction heartthrob Harry Styles, 25.

England rugby player Maro Itoje, 24, is fifth on the list as he is, as well as being a potential future England captain, 'something of an intellectual - he read politics at SOAS and is a sucker for a good documentary.'

No. 4: Former One Direction heartthrob Harry Styles, 25, pictured at the Met Gala in May

Nos. 5 & 6: England rugby player Maro Itoje, 24, left, is fifth on the list as he is, as well as being a potential future England captain, 'something of an intellectual. Sixth place goes to Paul Henkel, 23, who is the son of German billionaire industrialist Christoph Henkel (right together)

No. 7: England cricketer Jofra Archer, 24, pictured last month, is seventh on the list

Sixth place goes to Paul Henkel, 23, who is the son of German billionaire industrialist Christoph Henkel, who is 'rising up the ranks in the art world' after opening his own New York gallery earlier this year.

England cricketer Jofra Archer, 24, is seventh on the list while Umar Kamani, 31, a fashion businessman who set up fast fashion company PrettyLittleThings is in eighth place.

According to Tatler he 'stands out due to his outré clothing choices and bleached hair' and 'loves working out - the more extreme, the better. He also enjoys chess.'

Nos. 8&9: Umar Kamani, 31, a fashion businessman who set up fast fashion company PrettyLittleThings is in eighth place. Right, Ninth place on the list goes to Mathew Healy, 30, frontman of Brit Award-winning indie band, The 1975

Charles Robert George Innes-Ker, 38, who is the 11th Duke of Roxburghe, is in tenth place

Ninth place on the list goes to Mathew Healy, 30, frontman of Brit Award-winning indie band, The 1975, while Charles Robert George Innes-Ker, 38, who is the 11th Duke of Roxburghe, is in tenth place.

The divorced ex-army officer who 'inherited the dukedom, the magnificent Floors Castle in Scotland and an estimated £100 million fortune this year' founded a high-end chauffeur company and 'adores cars old and new' and 'salmon fishing in Norway.'

See the full feature in the 310th Anniversary December Issue of Tatler is available on newsstands and via digital download on Thursday 31st October.
description: According to the British society bible, Brooklyn, son of David and Victoria Beckham is the most sought after singleton of the year following his split from model Hana Cross this summer.
authors: Jennifer Rusenior Showbusiness Correspondent For The Daily Mail
